preQuizHtml:
Make it to the end of the quiz by answering all questions correctly.

Get two answers correct to advance to the next level.

In this quiz, the progress bar measures the OVERALL correct number of answers. If you get 4 correct, the quiz will end.

Also, the number of strikes similarly measures the OVERALL number of incorrect answers. If you get 3 wrong, the quiz will end.

questions.questionHtml: True or false? Moons revolve around planets.
Which planet is known as the "red planet"?

options.feedback: Correct! Mars is red due to iron rusting within its dust and dirt.
It's not Venus. Venus does have a reddish-brown surface, but not nearly as red as Mars'. Mars is red due to iron rusting within its dust and dirt.
Mercury is grey! Mars is red due to iron rusting within its dust and dirt.
Neptune is a bright blue. Mars is red due to iron rusting within its dust and dirt.

questions.questionHtml: The speed of light in a vaccuum (c) is 1,080,000,000 km/h.

options.feedback: Correct! The speed of light is a constant 1,080,000,000 km/h (299,792,458 m/s) in a vaccuum. That's SO FAST. If you had a ship that went at the speed of light, could go around earth over 7 times in one second.

The speed of light really is a constant 1,080,000,000 km/h (299,792,458 m/s) in a vaccuum. Blazing speed! If you had a ship that went at the speed of light, could go around earth over 7 times in one second.

questions.questionHtml: Place a checkmark beside the Gas Giant the planets.
questions.feedbackForPerfect: Correct! The rocky planets are Earth, Mercury, Venus, and Mars. Jupiter, Neptune, Saturn, and Uranus are all gas giants.
questions.feedbackForImperfect: The rocky planets are Earth, Mercury, Venus, and Mars. Jupiter, Neptune, Saturn, and Uranus are all gas giants.

questions.questionHtml: Rank the below planets in order of their size, starting with the smallest.
questions.hintHtml: Jupiter is the biggest planet! So it should be number 4.
questions.feedbackForPerfect:
Correct!

The order, for smallest to largest, is 1. Uranus, 2. Neptune, 3. Saturn, 4. Jupiter. Jupiter is the biggest!
questions.feedbackForImperfect:
That's the wrong order...

The order, for smallest to largest, is 1. Uranus, 2. Neptune, 3. Saturn, 4. Jupiter. Jupiter is the biggest!

questions.questionHtml: Match the terrestrial planets with the number of moons they have.
questions.feedbackForPerfect: Yes! Mars and Earth have moons. Mars with two, and Earth with one. Mercury and Venus don't have any moons! üëç
